data.body:
When I update libgdx from 0.9.9 to 1.2.0, my app doesn't work under windows desktop.

Please contact the application's support team for more information.

Program: D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_51\bin\java.exe

data.title: GWT can't capture keyboard events as a Facebook app
data.body:
When i deploy my game on Facebook as a game app, it seems that Facebook itself gets the input focus and captures the keyboard events; therefore the input object of Libgdx doesn't capture anything.

How can i force the focus on the game instead of the facebook page?

Thanks in advance.
Mariano

data.title: Added angle calculation methods to Vector2
data.body:
Added two methods to the Vector2 class, allowing to calculate angle between two vectors, and not only between the x-axis.

I'm not using the standard acos solution, math explained here: http://geomalgorithms.com/vector_products.html

Since the dot product is the cosine of the angle between two vectors, and the 2d cross product (perp dot) is the sine of the same angle, plugging both on a `atan2(crs, dot)` call can give the angle on the full circle (-180~+180, instead of `acos(dot)` solution, which gives only 0~180) and also avoid the two sqrts involved in normalising the vectors.

Here's another explanation on the matter: http://johnblackburne.blogspot.com.br/2012/01/angle-between-two-vectors.html

data.title: Adding a "listening" boolean value in Actor
data.body:
There's a boolean value called "visible" that controls both if the actor should draw and if it listen for input. 

There's times when you want stuff to render but not listen, but I do understand why this wouldn't be used a lot and complicate stuff (having to control two variables) 

after accidentally publishing this:

Having to remove all listeners and then putting them back together can be solved with a custom manager, so that's not a problem. 

My situation is that I have a custom created popup that shows up. Instead of having to create another stage that has the input processor and then having to render it and the one in the background, I would like to stop listening to the actors in the background, but still render them. But I understand that I'm not one of the majority that needs a "listening" variable. 

(Sorry for bad English)

If @NathanSweet doesn't think this is worth it, I will close it.

data.title: AbstractMethodError on IOSPreferences put methods
data.body:
I've recently encountered an error with the IOSPreferences. Whenever I try to put any settings I get the following error:

```
java.lang.AbstractMethodError: com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSPreferences.putString(Ljava.lang.String;Ljava.lang.String;)V
```

I can read settings without an exception but cannot use the "putString" method.

I've tried the latest nightly and compiled from source without any luck, one observation is that if I try to call putString("a","b") directly inside the getPreferences(String name) method in com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSApplication I can successfully use the method (save works and I can read the result). But for some reason - the returned preferences do not support the put methods.

I'm currently running:
- libgdx: 1.2.0 (same error with nightly)
- robovm: 0.13 (same error with robovm: 0.12)
- robovm: 0.13 (same error with robovm: 0.12)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new libgdx 1.2.0 project with gdx-setup
2. Add following line to eg. create():
 `Gdx.app.getPreferences("foo").putString("foo","bar");`
3. Run on iOS simulator or device.
4. Receive java exception.

data.title: catch error when MeshPartBuilder.patch() would fail silently
allowIpod config not working if music started after app is launched
data.body:
Setting allowIpod = true in IOSApplicationConfiguration seems to have no effect if the libGDX application is launched without any music playing.

Steps to reproduce:
- start libGDX app with music off  (with allowIpod = true)
- switch to iTunes/music app
- start music
- return to libGDX app (music stops, it should keep playing)

I get the same result in iOS 6 and 7
libGDX version: 1.2.0
roboVM version 0.0.14

There is another report of the same issue on stack overflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23473429/libgdx-robovm-allowipod-does-not-work-if-game-starts-then-paused

data.title: Fix FileHandle.list(FileFilter)
data.body:

I don't know if there is a better way to fix this, but this is a simple solution.

data.body: The latest Gradle setup app gdx-setup.jar fails with "Task 'afterEclipseImport' not found in root project 'destinationFolderNameHere'", when the option to generate Eclipse project files in advanced settings is checked and the desktop sub-project is unchecked. data.title: Gdx.files.local("").list(); returns nothing but Gdx.files.external("").list(); does
data.body: LwjglFiles.class doesn't correctly maintain or know about the local path on desktop. When trying to get a list of the DEFAULT local directory, Gdx.files.local("").list() does not return any files or list, however Gdx.files.external("").list() does. I believe this may be because the external path was hard coded on line 25 via the externalPath variable. Method: getLocalStoragePath, returns an empty string always and by default [Line: 69]? Is this known about and being worked on? WORK AROUND: Pass in a sub folder, and apparently the root path will be added. Gdx.files.external("saves/").list();

data.title: Make List dynamic like Tree in Scene2d.ui
data.body: I think for proper use List must have behaviour like in Tree, I mean the dynamic adding of items. For now list can only reset full items array. List unsuitable for chat or names of characters/players... I must use Tree for this kind of behaviour, but I think this isn't a good way...

data.title: MessageDispatcher: added support for multiple recipients.
data.body:
I've added support for multiple recipients while keeping both backward compatibility and unchanged performance in case of single recipient.
- Agents can register themselves to message codes they are interested in. This means that MessageDispatcher has an `IntMap<Array<Agent>>` where the key is the message code and the value an array of agents.  
- If the telegram is for a specific agent he doesn't have to be registered and the telegram will be dispatched only to him (just like before)
- If the telegram has no explicit recipient, i.e. `telegram.receiver == null`, it will be dispatched to all the agents registered for that message code. 

Now I'm at a crossroads. Telegrams are created and pooled by MessageDispatcher, also a telegram might have an extraInfo object containing message-specific information. The exraInfo object might be pooled by the application, why not? In case it's pooled, how can we let the app know that the telegram has been dispatched to all the receivers and that it can be returned to the pool? 
- **Option 1**:
  - The Agent interface has a new method `notifySender(Telegram)` that will be called by the MessageDispatcher after dispatching the telegram to the recipients and before returning the telegram to the pool. This gives the sender the opportunity to free the `telegram.extraInfo` object in case is pooled.
  - Additionally the sender might explicitly request the notification through an optional boolean parameter passed to the `MessageDispatcher.dispatchMessage()` method that creates the telegram. Of course this means that the telegram will have a new boolean field.
- **Option 2**:
  After dispatching the telegram to the recipients and before returning the telegram to the pool, the  MessageDispatcher first checks if `telegram.extraInfo instanceof Pooled` then calls the free method of the Pooled interface.

Option 2 is more specific and backward compatible while option 1 is more general (can be used - and abused - for all kind of stuff) but breaks compatibility.
Also, with option 1 it is responsibility of the sender to perform the right action based on the message code and the extraInfo object, since the sender can send telegrams carrying different types of message.

I'd like to know your opinion and of course any "option 3" is welcome :)

data.title: Added the ability to obtain an Interpolation via a String
data.body:
This is to make it easier to decide how to interpolate a value via a file.  See the new javadoc for the naming conventions you can use.

I also changed the `InterpolationTest` to use the new static `Interpolation.get()` method.  Works like a charm.  Also, the new method doesn't use reflection, just a big `ObjectMap` like the `Colors` class.  (You can also add your own `Interpolation`s.)

data.title: Cannot properly display 24-bit depth PNG images on Android
data.body:
I'm using GIMP on Linux and it usually saves the PNG files with the bit depth of 24. On desktop version it works fine but on android it does not show the png image properly (http://s16.postimg.org/hvssi16g1/test.png). But when I save the image with 32-bit depth, it works fine.
I'm using "libgdx-nightly-20140711" version.

data.title: Improved PriorityQueue when only unique elements are allowed.
data.body:
Removed redundant `set.contains(element)`.
Also, improved `ObjectSet.add` javadoc to clarify that the set remains unchanged when false is returned. This is important in this context because the element is pooled and must return to the pool after being rejected by the queue.

data.title: Table cell position incorrect when using small Viewport
better freetype font generator and management
data.body:
we're developing a Chinese game using libgdx and the game is text heavy, we use freetype font extension. we have some different fonts and sizes in the game. to make font rendering more optimal(for example, to make all appended text of a same font family in the same texture as much as possible),  we extend BitmapFont and BitmapFontCache to make them dynamically expandable, to access the two classes' interal fields we make the following modifications:
1. change all private fields in both classes to protected.
2. in BitmapFont ctor, make the cache creation extendable by providing a protected createCache() method.
3. make BitmapFont.load method protected.

we hope these changes can be made in libgdx official version.

thanks.

data.title: Adding custom timing possibility for MessageDispatcher
data.body:
Previous implementation used real-timing and pausing was not possible. E.g. if I post delayed message that should be dispatched in 3 sec and then pause my game for 3 or more secs, this message will be dispatched on next #dispatchDelayedMessages() immediately however in game 0 time have passed (cause of pause).

Current implementation allows you to set the custom TimeProvider (e.g. your game level timing) that might  support such things like pause/resume or slow motion timing. By default the RealTimeProvider is used implementing previous getCurrentTime to support backward-compatibility.

The other solution is to use something like standard #update(float delta) to accumulate current time, but this will be breaking implementation, so I used current approach.

data.title: [enhancement] [scene2d] Add addedToStage() and removedFromStage() methods to Actor
data.body:
Actor/Group have some useful methods for overriding, like `sizeChanged()` and `childrenChanged()`. I suggest to add methods `addedToStage()`, called when Actor is added to stage, and `removedFromStage()`, called when Actor is removed from stage.

This can be useful, for example, if Actors should listen to some outside events when on stage, but be available for GC when removed. For example, user can need to create label that updates it's text when user changes his language in app settings. Instead of managing label's text externally, it's easier for this kind of label to manage itself. It will just start listen when displayed and stop listen when removed. For now user can override `setStage()` method to achieve this functionality, but adding these methods looks cleaner.

data.title: Added MultiAspectViewport to support many aspect ratios
data.body:
Commit comment: Added MultiAspectViewport and created ViewportTestMultiAspectRatio for testing the class.

Summary: I needed a view port which could account for many aspect ratios, being 4:3 - 16:9. I liked the solution that was presented for Clash of the Olympians, but it did not work like they said. I now have a proper working version of what he was trying to create. This includes a test class to show how it works.

Basic idea: Creates a new FitViewport at largest possible size that preserves a certain range of view port aspect ratios and sizes. While it does not extend FitViewport, it does the same basic thing.

Here is a download to a working example (JAR): https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5FgN8-ZK8hPWUNka0Y5eG5zTFk/edit?usp=sharing

Here is virus total for the JAR: https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/29c32c5403183bb5bfec4fd46b3e426d5a9cf9966cce124a58e5a89530697975/analysis/1405450317/

**Ikarus is presenting a false positive for the virus total.

As you can see, for any give screen width and height it will not show red as long as it is between 4:3 and 16:9.

Please let me know if you think this would be helpful to libgdx and its community.

Thanks!
